description: Dive into "Chasing Waterfalls: Patong's Hidden Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chasing Waterfalls: Patong's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Bang Wan Waterfall is a hidden gem located in the charming Kamala village of Phuket. It's a beautiful place where visitors can enjoy nature and tranquility for free, unlike other waterfalls in the area. The waterfall is easily accessible by road with close parking and a hiking trail. Visitors can also join a rejuvenating yoga class surrounded by the beauty of nature every weekend. The sound of Tibetan bowls combined with the melody of the waterfall creates a calming atmosphere for meditation.

sources.snippet: You find it behind the village, about three kilometers from the beach (it is one of the places you only can find with Google maps). The waterfall is set in a lush jungle and surrounded by beautiful scenery, making it a nice place to visit if you are in Kamala anyway. To reach the waterfall, visitors must take a short hike through the jungle, which adds a little to the adventure and excitement of the journey.
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to All the Waterfalls in Phuket

sources.snippet: Bang Wan Waterfall l ‡πÄ‡∏™‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡∏ï‡∏Å‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô This trail is located in Kamala beach district in Phuket. It will take you through the stretches of forest to Bang Wan waterfall where you can explore various types of plants and wildlife along the way as well as enjoying the breathtaking waterfall. Wear breathable long pants to prevent mosquitoes.
sources.shortName: 10 Best waterfall trails in Phuket

sources.snippet: Bang Wan Waterfall is also in an easy-to-reach area of Phuket ‚Äì Kamala. It‚Äôs the next beach north of Patong. Kamala itself is a great area to stay in Phuket if you are looking for something a bit less fast-paced than Patong.
sources.shortName: 5 Phuket Waterfalls: Which ones should you visit
Beautiful trekking near Patong beach, Phuket

places.name: Bang Wan Waterfall

reviews.text: It seems like Ban Bang Wan Waterfall and Kamala Waterfall are part of the same stream. The entrances are very close to each other. The stream has few rocks, making it quite accessible. There's a trail available, but I haven't tried it yet.

A small, interesting, four-level waterfall. On the second level, the waterfall is blocked by barbed wire, but if you go along the path to the right, you can go much higher and get access directly to the stones over which the water falls and creates a lot of splashes - you can take cool photos in the wild there, but you have to be extremely careful!

A great place for those who love wild nature and hiking with cardio with a load, not counting the fact that you can take cool photos in the wild and without tourists!

*

When visiting this attraction, you need to stock up on water, repellents and have comfortable shoes

The best time to visit: June - October

Entrance: free

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the application üëâ PHUKETON

I had an amazing experience at Bang Wan Waterfall! This hidden gem in the charming Kamala village is a truly beautiful place. I highly recommend everyone to join the Waterfall yoga class every weekend from 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM. The combination of practicing yoga surrounded by nature's beauty is truly rejuvenating. What's even more special is the chance to meditate to the calming sound of Tibetan bowls while the waterfall's melody plays in the background. It's a unique and serene experience that I enjoyed immensely. Don't miss it!

places.address: W7MW+J7Q, Kamala, Kathu District, Phuket 83120, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a vibrant jungle setting, Kathu Waterfall is a hidden gem that promises an adventure for all ages. A short trek from the road leads you to this charming spot, conveniently located near Phuket Wake Park. While the base may seem unassuming, with a local eatery serving delicious made-to-order meals, the true beauty lies above. To reach the top of Kathu Waterfall, prepare for an exhilarating climb involving steep stairs and slippery rocks.

sources.snippet: If you want to see something out of a fantasy novel, Kathu Waterfall is definitely what you‚Äôre looking for. It‚Äôs not a massive waterfall by any means; instead, it‚Äôs a series of small falls with stepping stones that allow the water to cascade down the cliffside beautifully. There‚Äôs even a side path that you can climb to get to the top of the waterfall, but you have to be careful, as the track can be slippery.
sources.shortName: 4 of the Best Waterfalls in Phuket That You Must Visit - Mamy Booking

sources.snippet: Kathu waterfall is quite lovely during the rainy season as water cascades down four levels through the green jungle. This waterfall is on every Phuket map and very well indicated on the road when approaching Patong. It‚Äôs very popular with kids and parents who love to play in the stream while enjoying some local food sold in street carts and small stalls around.
sources.shortName: 4 Waterfalls To Discover In Phuket

sources.snippet: If you are in Phuket in the raining season, and wand to see the best waterfall on the island, visit Kathu waterfall. The location is more convenient than many of the others, as it‚Äôs the closest on this list to Patong, Phuket‚Äôs main tourist hub. With no entry fee and a few levels to explore, Kathu Waterfall is a great option for a morning or afternoon excursion.
sources.shortName: 5 Phuket Waterfalls: Which ones should you visit

sources.snippet: Kathu isn‚Äôt a waterfall in the way you might think of Victoria Falls, it‚Äôs more rain shower than cascading falls, but this gorgeous spot is well worth the trek. The waterfall has a series of small drop pools that visitors can bathe and relax in. These pools are reached by climbing a wide set of steep stairs and a path through the jungle.
sources.shortName: 8 Phuket hiking trails for nature lovers

sources.snippet: Instead of one massive fall, the Kathu Waterfall has a series of mesmerising cascades and drop pools. The best time to visit Kathu is during the rainy season (from June to November) as the water flow is highest during this time. That being said, the path leading to the waterfall gets slippery so tread lightly when you visit this place.
sources.shortName: The 5 Most Wonderful Waterfalls In Phuket in 2024

sources.snippet: Kathu Waterfall is rather more a series of drop pools and cascades than one massive fall. The best time to visit Kathu is from June to November when the monsoon water feeds the fall, substantially adding to its flow. That being said, try to avoid visiting the waterfall on rainy days, as the footpath can get slippery.
sources.shortName: A Guide to Phuket‚Äôs Waterfalls

sources.snippet: The magnificent Kathu Waterfall is a sight you should not miss to visit especially if you want to enjoy the views of the entire region. The trail starts with a lush sea of green forestry until you reach the waterfall. From there you can continue to the peak and see the marvellous scenery from the top.
sources.siteName: Haute Retreats | The Best in Luxury Villa Rentals | + 1 888 279 6444
sources.shortName: Top 7 Hiking Trails in Phuket

sources.snippet: Only a few kilometres from where we live is the highest point in Phuket, over 540m above sea level, and near this hill you have Kathu waterfall. It's only a short drive from Patong beach into the Kathu area of Phuket. The road up to the falls is a residential area, we have many friends up this road.
sources.shortName: Phuket Waterfalls | The Phuket Blog

sources.snippet: The Kathu waterfall is conveniently located in the centre of the Phuket island near Patong. It has a series of drop pools leading all the way up to the main pool which is at an elevation. The ascent is quite challenging but the view you get after reaching the top is certainly worth all the effort.
sources.shortName: The Best 5 Waterfalls in Phuket

sources.snippet: One of the most unique waterfalls on Phuket is Kathu Waterfall. Instead of water falling vertically into a pool like a regular waterfall, Kathu Waterfall features a sequence of drop pools. Although it will be difficult to climb the waterfall, there are staircases that can make your climb easier.
sources.shortName: A List of Best Waterfalls in Phuket That You Should Check Out | Ayara Kamala Resort

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre a bigger fan of waterfalls than you are of beaches or simply a fan of both, then Kathu Waterfall is a must-visit place. At the top of the waterfall, you are promised a spectacular view of the jungle, not to mention all the other beautiful scenes as you make your way up there.
sources.shortName: Planning Your Next Hiking Journey 3 Stunning Trails in Phuket

sources.snippet: Nearby Hotspots: Patong Beach (9 km), Phuket Town (13 km), Kata Beach (19 km). If you‚Äôre itching for a free visit, visiting Kathu Waterfall is the place to go. What‚Äôs more, you‚Äôre in for a treat as this 3-tiered cascade, with steps up to 130 meters, can be the most enchanting.
sources.shortName: A Guide to Visiting Phuket‚Äôs 4 Most Beautiful Waterfalls

sources.snippet: Want to know why Kathu Waterfall is one of the most interesting waterfalls to visit in Phuket?. Well, as long as you visit it during the rainy season, you will enjoy this immense series of drop pools to maximum effect and you will realize that this place is worth a look.
sources.shortName: Kathu Waterfall in Phuket

places.name: Kathu Waterfall

reviews.text:
Kathu Waterfall is a popular natural attraction located in Kathu District, Phuket, Thailand. It is known for its series of cascading pools and lush surroundings, making it a refreshing spot for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Here's a detailed guide to Kathu Waterfall:

Key Features of Kathu Waterfall

Multi-Tiered Cascades:¬†The waterfall consists of several tiers, with drop pools along the way. The first tier features a pool suitable for swimming, while higher levels offer scenic views and quieter spots for relaxation.

Staircase Access:¬†Visitors can climb up a 130-meter staircase to explore the different levels of the waterfall. The climb can be steep but is shaded, with rest stops available.

Natural Beauty:¬†Surrounded by dense tropical vegetation, the area provides a tranquil escape from Phuket's bustling tourist spots.

Best Time to Visit

The waterfall is most active during the rainy season, from June to November. This period ensures a steady water flow and vibrant greenery. However, visitors should avoid heavy rains as the stairs can become slippery.   Kathu Waterfall, Phuket

A tame waterfall during dry season. So I cannot strongly recommend it. But still nice!

Nevertheless, still a nice side adventure if you want a small hike. There are a moderate number of steps to - and past - the first waterfall.

And then a short jungle walk which is quite tranquil to the very top.

Also a nice couple of cafes at the bottom!

An interesting place with a very beautiful picture.

At the very bottom level there is a small pool for very small children. The main waterfall is located a little higher, after going up the steps.

There is very beautiful flora and rich fauna here. Trees with huge trunk diameters and powerful roots, vines and various plants and flowers create a special, indescribable atmosphere in this place. There are spiders, snakes and lizards - they can mainly be found early in the morning and late in the evening.

Access to the waterfall is easy, so this place can be visited with children to let them splash in the water and take photos for memory!

*

When visiting this attraction, you need to stock up on water, repellents and have comfortable shoes

best time to visit: June - October

entrance: free

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

places.generalDescription: Kamala Waterfall, also known as Bang Wan Waterfall, is a stunning natural gem located near Villa Tantawan. This picturesque spot features four cascading levels, though visitors can only access the second level. Surrounded by lush tropical foliage and towering trees, it offers a peaceful retreat where you can unwind in nature's embrace.

sources.snippet: Kamala Waterfall (Bang Wan Waterfall) is a nice place to visit during your stay at Villa Tantawan. Although swimming here is not allowed for safety reasons, it is not far from the resort and it‚Äôs worth a visit for a short exploration to relax and indulge yourself surrounded by lush tropical nature. The waterfall consists of 4 levels but people can only get to the second level.
sources.shortName: Kamala Beach Phuket | all you need to know

places.name: Kamala Waterfall

reviews.text: Kamala Waterfall is a breathtakingly beautiful natural wonder nestled amidst lush greenery. Tall trees surround the area, providing a serene and tranquil atmosphere. The melodious songs of birds add to the enchanting ambiance, making it an ideal spot for yoga enthusiasts. Every weekend, from 8:30 to 10:00 AM, it becomes a haven for yoga and sound healing sessions, where participants can connect with nature's beauty while nurturing their mind, body, and soul.
There is a sign no swim.no too sure of the reason.maybe the locals can explain.wat a waste..overgrown grass...on path.

You cant access the waterfall. It is closed. However you can jump into the pond at your own risk. We saw some local boys swimming there.

Not worth the trip.

places.address: W7PW+383, Kamala, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand
